---
title: "extend_2.toml"
---

## High-level description
This TOML configuration file extends the Gitleaks configuration by including another configuration file and defining an additional rule for detecting AWS Secret Keys. It demonstrates the use of configuration extension and custom rule definition in Gitleaks.

## Symbols

### `title`
#### Description
Specifies the title of the Gitleaks configuration.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| title | string | The title of the configuration |

### `[extend]`
#### Description
Defines the extension configuration, specifying another TOML file to be included.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| path | string | The relative path to the TOML file to be included |

### `[[rules]]`
#### Description
Defines a custom rule for detecting AWS Secret Keys.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| description | string | A brief description of the rule |
| id | string | A unique identifier for the rule |
| regex | string | A regular expression pattern to match AWS Secret Keys |
| tags | array of strings | Labels associated with the rule |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| title | string | "gitleaks extended 2" | The title of the Gitleaks configuration |
| extend.path | string | "../testdata/config/extend_3.toml" | Path to another TOML file to be included |

## API/Interface Reference
| Rule ID | Description | Regex Pattern | Tags |
|:--------|:------------|:--------------|:-----|
| aws-secret-key-again | AWS Secret Key | `(?i)aws_(.{0,20})?=?.[\'\"0-9a-zA-Z\/+]{40}` | ["key", "AWS"] |

This configuration file extends the Gitleaks functionality by including another configuration file (`extend_3.toml`) and defining an additional rule for detecting AWS Secret Keys. The rule uses a case-insensitive regular expression to match potential AWS secret keys in the scanned content.
